instructions: To help centralize opportunities, LOCVM summarizes postings available online. postTitle: Family Medicine Locum Ottawa +/- FHO transfer
schedule:
I'm looking for a locum Family Physician to help with my well-established practice of ~1100 patients starting September 1, 2025 (end date flexible).

Location: South Ottawa Medical Centre (www.somc.info).
We are a dynamic, supportive FHO group comprised of 13 family doctors + 1 general surgeon + 1 psychiatrist + 1 GP-derm + 1 travel medicine MD. EMR: PSS. Ocean for patient communications. Dynacare in-house for our patients.

Payment model: full FHO capitation income (including access bonus) + FFS shadow billings + third party billing - all minus the overhead
Number of half-days per week and number of patients per half-day: up to the locum (currently 4 half-days per week + 1 evening urgent care clinic per month + 1 Saturday q13weeks)
I am available for mentorship and clinic coverage - so ideal for a new grad transitioning to practice! Also potential to join FHO long-term if interested.

I am happy to answer further questions - please email eliseazzimd@gmail.com

additionalPayInfo: $550/half day
instructions: Office is located on second floor, above Shoppers Drug Mart
notes: FHO of ~1050. Lovely colleagues, excellent office.

additionalPayInfo:
Looking for 1 day per week locum to support our physician-run clinic in the Upper Beaches neighbourhood in Toronto (Vivo Family Medicine). FHO Practice. Beautiful clinic, incredibly supportive admin and full-time staff trained directly by me. Pharmacy onsite. Telus PS Suite EMR, Ocean e-referral, secure messaging, streamlined patient queries (through portal), HRM, OLIS, OTN, SCOPE referral support, and seamless integration of virtual and in-person patient care.
Flexible commitment, no weekend requirement. $1100 per day + 3rd party billing + 100% shadow billing/FFS/Out of basket + hourly pay for inbox management.
P.S. We are AI-powered (by Pippen AI) and you will have complementary free access!
Please message me if interested.
instructions: Suite 102 ; we are directly located at the street level.
notes: $1100 per day + 100% shadow billing/FFS/Out of Basket + 3rd Party

additionalPayInfo: $500 per half day, shadow billing, third party billing

notes: This is a small (~500), low-acuity, well-managed patient roster—a perfect fit for someone looking for a smooth locum experience. The clinic is friendly and well-organized, using OSCAR Pro EMR, with excellent administrative support. Our experienced staff prep exam rooms, take vitals, and manage patient flow so you can focus on patient care. Additional perks include free and ample parking and a pharmacy on site. Enjoy working in a supportive, collegial environment with flexibility and excellent infrastructure.

postTitle: 3-Month Locum Opportunity in FHO/FHT Practice in Dundas (50-020-25)
schedule: A solo FHO/FHT practice in the quaint town of Dundas is seeking a locum physician to provide coverage for the practice until September 2025. The successful candidate will be caring for a roster of approximately 1,500 – 1,600 patients and can expect to see less than 20 patients per full day. Flexible start date.

additionalPayInfo: FFS Payment Model
instructions: If you are compassionate about providing end-of-life options to the residents of Hamilton and the surrounding area, you may be interested in joining the team. The Medical Assistance in Dying Community Outreach Team is a group of professionals that help individuals reach their end-of-life goals by providing home visits for assessments and provisions of MAiD and works within the recommendations of CAMAP (Canadian Association of MAiD Assessors and Providers) as far as medication protocols and standards of care. Mentoring is available for independent assessments, provider assessments and provisions.
notes:
The following commitments are required to be considered for the available positions:
•	Becoming a member of CAMAP
•	Complete the CAMAP Curriculum for assessors and providers: Curriculum Overview – CAMAP | ACEPA
•	Agree to attend monthly team meetings
•	Commit to a minimum of 2-4 hours per week during business hours for in-person assessments and provisions

Interested candidates are advised to send their CV via email to the GHHN recruitment team at Recruitment@GHHN.ca. Please reference the posting number in the subject line.
postTitle: Join the Hamilton Medical Assistance in Dying Community Outreach Team (50-019-25)

postTitle: Opportunity at a Community Health Centre in Hamilton (Bilingual) (50-057-24)
schedule:
The Centre de santé communautaire Hamilton Niagara is looking for a bilingual family physician to join their team for 3 to 6 months, August 2025-March 2026.

The ideal candidate will be available to provide 14-28 hours of coverage per week (2-4 days/week) and will work as part of an excellent team alongside 3 other physicians. The Centre de santé communautaire Hamilton supports Hamilton’s Francophone community and operates Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm.

additionalPayInfo: $1100 per day ($550 per half day), all third party and shadow billings
instructions: Located inside the Pharmasave building
schedule: Great opportunity to locum in a small clinic with 3 other experienced doctors and great clinical staff! 3 days per week (or 6 half days per week), flexible scheduling.

additionalPayInfo: The successful candidate can expect a competitive daily stipend.
instructions:
A physician in a solo FHO/FHT practice, co-located with two other physicians, is looking for locum support for three months, September-November 2025. The ideal candidate will start August 25th to be able to spend a week with the physician to learn more about the daily routine of the practice.

Working within a high-functioning team to support a roster of 1,700 patients, the locum will be supported by a receptionist and an RN as well as FHT supports including a Registered Dietitian, Mental Health Counsellor, Pharmacist, Psychiatrist and COPD specialist. 

The office has 3 exam rooms, a private office, a kitchenette and free parking. The office uses Telus PS EMR and Ocean for eReferrals.

Interested candidates are advised to send their CV via email to the GHHN recruitment team at Recruitment@GHHN.ca. Please reference the posting number in the subject line.
schedule: During the three months, the locum can expect to work 3 or 3-1/2 days per week, working Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and optional Friday mornings. Office hours are 8:30-5:00PM, and while seeing patients between 8:45-4:30PM, the locum can expect to see ~25 patients per day. Should the candidate be interested, there is opportunity to also provide LTC coverage to two locations within the Hamilton area. After-hour coverage is not required.

additionalPayInfo: Primary Compensation Type: Fee-For-Service Split
instructions: Office is located a few steps from Kipling Station

schedule:
6-Month Locum Opportunity in FHO/FHT Practice in Dundas
Posting #50-024-25

A solo FHO/FHT practice in the quaint town of Dundas is seeking a locum physician to provide coverage for the practice starting as soon as possible, covering until end of January 2026. The successful candidate will be caring for a roster of approximately 1,500 – 1,600 patients and can expect to see less than 20 patients per full day.

As part of the Hamilton Family Health Team, this practice is well supported by a variety of Allied Health Professionals including a Nurse, Clinical Pharmacist, Social Worker/Mental Health Counsellor, Dietitian, and Psychiatrist. Administrative support is provided by a receptionist and an off-site office manager. The office is fully computerized and utilizes Telus PS Suite EMR for patient records.  

The locum physician will have access to 2 exam rooms and an office and parking is free for staff. The practice is also located next to a pharmacy.

The locum will receive a competitive daily stipend for this work.

Interested candidates are advised to send their CV via email to the GHHN recruitment team at Recruitment@GHHN.ca. Please reference the posting number in the subject line.

schedule:
multidisciplinary care focused in women’s health and racialized populations

Women's Health In Women's Hands

additionalPayInfo: The successful candidate will receive a competitive daily stipend for the weekday shifts, with the option for additional income through FFS weekend work (keeping 90% billings), should they choose to do so.
instructions:
This solo practice, part of a 25-member FHO and part of the Hamilton Family Health Team is supported by an on-site clinical pharmacist and social worker as well as by an off-site registered dietitian. The practice also has excellent support from a two part-time RPNs. The practice has well-staffed admin support for billing, booking and other admin functions. With a current roster of 2,000 well-managed patients, the locum can expect to see 20-24 patients per day.

The office has 4 exam rooms, an allied health room, private office space, a large lunchroom, kitchenette, separate staff and patient washrooms and free parking for both staff and patients. The office is co-located with a pharmacy that has its own counselling room. The practice uses Telus EMR, offers self-check in for patients and is moving to digital bookings through OCEAN. 

The practice is located near the Lincoln Alexander Parkway for an easy commute from the 403 or Redhill Valley Parkway. The practice is located near many restaurants and amenities and a less than 15 minutes from the Juravinski hospital.

The successful candidate will receive a competitive daily stipend for the weekday shifts, with the option for additional income through FFS weekend work (keeping 90% billings), should they choose to do so.

Interested candidates are advised to send their CV via email to the GHHN recruitment team at Recruitment@GHHN.ca. Please reference the posting number in the subject line.

The practice hours are 9:00-6:00 Monday-Thursday and 9:00-1:00PM on Fridays, but there is flexibility on hours during the three weeks coverage. With remote access available, part of the coverage can be done virtually, if desired. Should the locum be interested, there is option to additionally work on Saturdays for 4-6 hours between the hours of 10:00-4:00PM.

postTitle: Long-Term Locum Opportunity in a FHO/FHT Group Practice (50-027-25)
schedule:
A physician who is part of a 2-member group practice is seeking a long-term locum to support the practice 2 ½ days per week starting in Fall 2025 (flexible start date).

The practice has a diverse roster with patients of all ages and backgrounds and receives administrative support from 5 clerical staff including 2 receptionists (shared between the group), book-keeping/billing staff, and support staff for booking appointments/tests. 

As part of the Hamilton Family Health Team, the practice also receives extensive support from allied health professionals including significant nursing support provided by 3 Registered Nurses and 1 full-time Nurse Practitioner. Additional allied health support is provided by a clinical pharmacist, a registered dietitian, a psychiatrist, and a mental health counsellor. 

The practice uses P&P EMR (training is available) and on-site facilities include 4 exam rooms, a private office/charting area, and a reception area/waiting room. The location also hosts a pharmacy, x-ray/ultrasound clinic, physiotherapy clinic, and dental office, and parking is free for both staff and patients. 

Conveniently located on the fast-growing Southwest Hamilton Mountain and just minutes away from the Lincoln Alexander Parkway, this well-equipped practice is easily accessible. 

Interested candidates are advised to send their CV via email to the GHHN recruitment team at Recruitment@GHHN.ca. Please refer to the posting number in the subject line.

schedule:
Regular Work Day:
-	Round on inpatients between 08:30 – 09:00. Usually you will have between 0-2 inpatients.
-	Clinic starts at 10:00am. Clinic hours:10-12 1-4. We book 20 minute appts and no fit ins.
-	Post Call Clinic: 10-12 (or any two hour block you would like, and you are paid for the full clinic day)
**Friday mornings at 08:30 inpatient handover rounds at the nursing station – please come and handover your inpatients or get handover if you’re on call over the weekend.

Call Days
-	Call is 24hour 07:00am-07:00am (Our ER is low volume ~ 17 patients/shifts; NP assist)
-	Family Health Team RNs see walk-in same day patients for you. They will ask you to assess patients and sign scripts as needed. You will thus need to be available to the Family Health Team nurses between 08:00am – 04:00pm on weekdays.

facilityName: Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre
notes:
Thunder Bay Paediatrician Full Time Coverage for 6 month Locum

We are looking for a full time locum to cover a maternity leave from May 1 to October 31, 2026. We would be happy to also consider candidates who are able to cover for a shorter time commitment as well. 

As a member of our team, you will assist in the provision of Pediatric Care in the following program components;
• Level IIC NICU
• Paediatric inpatient care including on call coverage 
• Outpatient paediatric clinic including diabetes care, complex care, development, mental health, and all aspects of general paediatrics

The position includes:
• Opportunity to join an established group practice (Thunder Bay Paediatrics)
• Participation in On-Call at the Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre (1:10)
• Generously funded via an Alternate Payment Plan (APP)
• Outpatient clinic space 
• Opportunity for Academic Affiliation with NOSM University

Applicants should be:
• Eligible for licensure in Ontario and a Royal College certified Paediatrician
• Interested in teaching medical students & residents

About our Practice:
The paediatrics group in Thunder Bay includes ten paediatricians who serve the children of Northwestern Ontario from just past Sault Ste Marie to the Manitoba border including the fly in Indigenous reserve communities and split inpatient work evenly. Our regional hospital, Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre, has a 14 bed Level 2C NICU, a 12 bed inpatient paediatrics unit, a new neonatal/paediatric transport team, provides inpatient on call coverage, and each have our own outpatient paediatric practice, located at Thunder Bay Paediatrics. We are a friendly and supportive team who are happy to provide guidance. Our program features numerous subspecialty clinics, including diabetes, autism, gender affirming care, eating disorders, complex care, hematology, allergy, transport medicine, and a Paediatric Oncology Group of Ontario satellite clinic. This role offers a unique opportunity for academic scholarship, including teaching undergraduate and postgraduate medical learners from NOSM University including our paediatric residents.

Community:
Thunder Bay is a city of approximately 110 000 in Northwestern, Ontario located on the beautiful shores of Lake Superior. Thunder Bay is known as one of Canada’s greatest outdoor cities with great cuisine, easy access to hiking and other outdoor pursuits, and cultural events. 

Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. Please contact sfernandez@nosm.ca to apply or for additional details. Thanks

instructions: Physicians will use their own EMR
notes: This role is part of a mobile occupational health clinic delivering on-site medical care directly at industrial workplaces. By bringing care to workers, the mobile clinic reduces time away from work, improves access to timely assessments, and supports early identification of work-related issues. Physicians practice in a focused, low-acuity environment with an emphasis on functional assessment, injury prevention, and workplace health, helping workers stay safe and productive while minimizing disruption to operations.

🏙️ Just 90 minutes north of Toronto with easy access to Highway 400 
🏡 Ideal for families, outdoor enthusiasts, and physicians seeking balance 
🛶 While others head north on Fridays — you’re already here 

HOSPITAL AFFILIATION: Orillia Soldiers’ Memorial Hospital (OSMH) offers a full range of services including
-Emergency, medical, and surgical care 
-Regional programs in: 
--Orthopedics 
--Kidney care 
--Mental health 
--Senior's care 
--Sexual assault & domestic violence care 
--Pediatrics & Neonatal ICU
schedule:
PRACTICE MODEL & CLINIC OPPORTUNITIES
-Family Health Organization (FHO) with Family Health Team (FHT) funding 
-Comprehensive primary care across all ages 
-Opportunity to develop focused interests, including: 
--Obstetrics 
--Palliative care 
--Emergency Medicine 
--Hospitalist medicine 
--OR assisting 
--High demand population with complex and geriatric care needs 
--Build to full practice capacity within 2 years (new grads supported) 

As part of the Family Health Organization, your patients benefit from access to an extensive interdisciplinary team, including: 
-Nurse Practitioners & Pharmacists 
-Dietitians & Chiropodists 
-Occupational Therapists & Kinesiologists 
-Social Workers & Registered Psychotherapists 
-Geriatric Outreach Team 
-Psychiatry & Mental Health Services 
-Internists (CHF/COPD), Respirology, Geriatrics 
-Rapid Access Low Back Pain Clinic 
-One of Ontario’s four fully funded Transgender Health Programs

additionalPayInfo:
COMPENSATION MODEL: Blended Capitation (FHO)
TEACHING OPPORTUNITY: Yes 
PRACTICE TYPE: Clinic based primary care with optional ED, inpatient, LTC, OB, anesthesia, and more.

RECRUITMENT INCENTIVES (ROS Eligible) 
✔ Licensing support 
✔ Overhead support 
✔ Relocation assistance 
✔ Immigration support 
✔ Interestfree loan support for clinic establishment 
✔ Locum coordination 
✔ 1:1 mentorship program during your first year of practice 
✔ First-year CME support (membership with the Foundation for Medical Practice Education) 

REMUNERATION
-Blended capitation under the FHO model 
-OHIP and reciprocal billings 
-Earning potential dependent on roster size 

NORTHERN & RURAL INCENTIVES
-Eligible fulltime physicians may qualify for: Severn: $81,200 ,Ramara: $80,800 
-Canada Student Loan forgiveness: up to $60,000 

ADDITIONAL BENEFITS
-Pregnancy & Parental Leave Benefit Program (PPLBP): Up to $1,300/week
instructions:
QUALIFICATIONS
-Licensed or eligible for licensure with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario (CPSO) 
-CFPC certification in Family Medicine 

AMERICAN TRAINED PHYSICIANS WELCOME
-ABFM certified physicians eligible for Ontario’s streamlined licensing pathway 
-No additional exams required 
-Transition to independent practice faster than ever
notes:
Why Choose Orillia & Lake Country? 
🚗 Commutes measured in minutes, not hours 
🌊 Located on the shores of Lake Couchiching and Lake Simcoe 
🏙️ Only 90 minutes north of Toronto with easy highway access 
🏡 Ideal for families, outdoor enthusiasts, and physicians seeking balance 
⛷️ Skiing, cycling, waterfront parks, arts, and culture at your doorstep 
On Fridays, when others are heading north — you’re already home. 

DISCOVER LIFE IN ORILLIA
-Five waterfront parks 
-State-of-the-art library and entertainment centre 
-60 alpine ski runs & 82 km of trails 
-Vibrant arts community including: 
--Orillia Opera House 
--Leacock Museum 
--Museum of Art & History 
-Home to major employers including OPP Headquarters, Casino Rama, Georgian College, and Lakehead University
schedule:
CLINICAL PRACTICE & FLEXIBILITY
-Family Health Organization (FHO) model 
-Comprehensive primary care across all ages and stages of health 
-Ability to pursue enhanced or focused practices, including: 
--Obstetrics 
--Palliative care 
--Emergency Medicine 
--Hospitalist care 
--Longterm care 
--OR assisting 
-High demand community with patients actively waiting for care 
-New physicians supported to build to full capacity within two years 

HOSPITAL AFFILIATION
Orillia Soldiers’ Memorial Hospital (OSMH) provides a comprehensive range of services, including: 
-Emergency, medical, and surgical care 
-Regional programs in: 
--Kidney care 
--Orthopedics 
--Adult mental health 
--Senior's care 
--Sexual assault & domestic violence treatment 
--Pediatrics and neonatal intensive care 
-Physicians interested in hospital work will be supported with introductions and hospital tours. 

COMMUNITY SITE VISIT SUPPORT
Our Community Physician Recruiter will conduct a personalized needs assessment prior to your visit to tailor the experience for you and your family. During your visit, we will: 
-Introduce you to potential colleagues 
-Tour clinic and hospital facilities 
-Explore housing, schools, and community amenities 
We also support settlement services, including housing, school registration, and community integration.

instructions: Physicians will use their own EMR
notes:
This role is part of a mobile occupational health clinic delivering on-site medical care directly at industrial workplaces. 

By bringing care to workers, the mobile clinic reduces time away from work, improves access to timely assessments, and supports early identification of work-related issues. Physicians practice in a focused, low-acuity environment with an emphasis on functional assessment, injury prevention, and workplace health, helping workers stay safe and productive while minimizing disruption to operations.
postTitle: Family Physician – Occupational / Industrial Medicine (on-site, Daily Guarantee)
schedule: The mobile clinic operates from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m., with patient volume to be confirmed prior to the shift.

postTitle: Wawa Family Health Team - Locum -  URGENT COVERAGE NEEDED March 26 To 31, 2026
schedule:
Clinic Days:
-	Round on inpatients between 08:30 – 09:00. Usually you will have between 0-2 inpatients.
-	Clinic starts at 10:00am. Clinic hours:10-12 1-4. We book 20 minute appts and no fit ins.
-	Post Call Clinic: 10-12 (or any two hour block you would like, and you are paid for the full clinic day)

Call Days:
-	Call is 24hour 07:00am-07:00am (Our ER is low volume ~ 17 patients/shifts; NP assist)
-	Family Health Team RNs see walk-in same day patients for you. They will ask you to assess patients and sign scripts as needed. You will thus need to be available to the Family Health Team nurses between 08:00am – 04:00pm on weekdays.
